medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain and one episode of emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started at 6 PM last night, described as the worst pain experienced by the patient, localized to RUQ, and occurred shortly after a meal. The pain is non-radiating. There was one episode of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis. Patient reports intermittent chills and sweats associated with the bouts of pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis, history of cholecystitis, cholelithiasis, and biliary colic.
